intro: Alyxia buxifolia, commonly known as the waxleaf alyxia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are often mistaken for those of boxwood. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy flowers. Alyxia buxifolia thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil.
